sources.title: Utu (1983)
sources.description: Utu is a 1983 New Zealand war film that follows Te Wheke, a MƒÅori warrior who initially fights for the British during the New Zealand Wars. After discovering that colonial forces have destroyed his village and killed his family, he deserts the British and embarks on a quest for revenge against those responsible, leading to a violent insurgency against the colonizers. Co-written and directed by Geoff Murphy, the films stars Anzac Wallace, Bruno Lawrence, Tim Eliott, Ilona Rodgers, Wi Kuki Kaa and Merata Mita. T he film is set in 1870 in the North Island and has been described as a New Zealand Western.

metadata.Plot: In New Zealand in the 1860s the native Maori people fought the British colonials to keep the land guaranteed to them by treaty. The warrior Te Wheke fights for the British until betrayal leads him to seek utu (revenge). The settler Williamson in turn seeks revenge after Te Wheke attacks his homestead. Meanwhile Wiremu, an officer for the British, seems to think that resistance is futile.
metadata.Actors: Anzac Wallace, Bruno Lawrence, Tim Elliott
